channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Shotgun crystal structure prediction using machine-learned formation energies
item.description: Stable or metastable crystal structures of assembled atoms can be predicted by finding the global or local minima of the energy surface with respect to the atomic configurations.

item.title: Towards Being Parameter-Efficient: A Stratified Sparsely Activated Transformer with Dynamic Capacity
item.description: However, recent studies have established that MoE models are inherently parameter-inefficient as the improvement in performance diminishes with an increasing number of experts.

item.title: Multimodal Data Augmentation for Image Captioning using Diffusion Models
item.description: Image captioning, an important vision-language task, often requires a tremendous number of finely labeled image-caption pairs for learning the underlying alignment between images and texts.

item.title: Pre-train and Search: Efficient Embedding Table Sharding with Pre-trained Neural Cost Models
item.description: In this work, we explore a "pre-train, and search" paradigm for efficient sharding.

item.title: A Lightweight CNN-Transformer Model for Learning Traveling Salesman Problems
item.description: Our model consumes approximately 20% less GPU memory usage and has 45% faster inference time compared with other state-of-the-art Transformer-based models.

item.title: An Exploration of Conditioning Methods in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: The flexibility and effectiveness of message passing based graph neural networks (GNNs) induced considerable advances in deep learning on graph-structured data.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Segmentation of Functional Tissue Units at the Cellular Level
item.description: We present a new method for functional tissue unit segmentation at the cellular level, which utilizes the latest deep learning semantic segmentation approaches together with domain adaptation and semi-supervised learning techniques.

item.title: Zenseact Open Dataset: A large-scale and diverse multimodal dataset for autonomous driving
item.description: Existing datasets for autonomous driving (AD) often lack diversity and long-range capabilities, focusing instead on 360{\deg} perception and temporal reasoning.

item.title: A Neural Divide-and-Conquer Reasoning Framework for Image Retrieval from Linguistically Complex Text
item.description: Inspired by the Divide-and-Conquer algorithm and dual-process theory, in this paper, we regard linguistically complex texts as compound proposition texts composed of multiple simple proposition sentences and propose an end-to-end Neural Divide-and-Conquer Reasoning framework, dubbed NDCR.

item.title: Dynamic Sparse Training with Structured Sparsity
item.description: DST methods achieve state-of-the-art results in sparse neural network training, matching the generalization of dense models while enabling sparse training and inference.

item.title: Improving Contrastive Learning of Sentence Embeddings from AI Feedback
item.description: Our method utilizes AI feedback from large pre-trained language models (LLMs) to construct sample pairs with fine-grained sample similarity scores to improve contrastive learning.

item.title: AttenWalker: Unsupervised Long-Document Question Answering via Attention-based Graph Walking
item.description: To alleviate the problem, it might be possible to generate long-document QA pairs via unsupervised question answering (UQA) methods.

item.title: CodeGen2: Lessons for Training LLMs on Programming and Natural Languages
item.description: In this study, we attempt to render the training of LLMs for program synthesis more efficient by unifying four key components: (1) model architectures, (2) learning methods, (3) infill sampling, and, (4) data distributions.

item.title: Bicubic++: Slim, Slimmer, Slimmest -- Designing an Industry-Grade Super-Resolution Network
item.description: We propose a real-time and lightweight single-image super-resolution (SR) network named Bicubic++.

item.title: DocLangID: Improving Few-Shot Training to Identify the Language of Historical Documents
item.description: In this work, we propose DocLangID, a transfer learning approach to identify the language of unlabeled historical documents.

item.title: Understanding cirrus clouds using explainable machine learning
item.description: Their dependencies on meteorological and aerosol conditions are among the largest uncertainties in global climate models.

item.title: The Benefits of Label-Description Training for Zero-Shot Text Classification
item.description: Large language models have improved zero-shot text classification by allowing the transfer of semantic knowledge from the training data in order to classify among specific label sets in downstream tasks.

item.title: "Glitch in the Matrix!": A Large Scale Benchmark for Content Driven Audio-Visual Forgery Detection and Localization
item.description: The proposed baseline method, Boundary Aware Temporal Forgery Detection (BA-TFD), is a 3D Convolutional Neural Network-based architecture which efficiently captures multimodal manipulations.

item.title: Causality-aware Concept Extraction based on Knowledge-guided Prompting
item.description: The prompt adopts the topic of the given entity from the existing knowledge in KGs to mitigate the spurious co-occurrence correlations between entities and biased concepts.

item.title: Scaling-up Remote Sensing Segmentation Dataset with Segment Anything Model
item.description: The success of the Segment Anything Model (SAM) demonstrates the significance of data-centric machine learning.

item.title: Robust Natural Language Watermarking through Invariant Features
item.description: Recent years have witnessed a proliferation of valuable original natural language contents found in subscription-based media outlets, web novel platforms, and outputs of large language models.

item.title: NorQuAD: Norwegian Question Answering Dataset
item.description: In this paper we present NorQuAD: the first Norwegian question answering dataset for machine reading comprehension.

item.title: From Local to Global: Navigating Linguistic Diversity in the African Context
item.description: The focus is on critical problems in NLP related to linguistic diversity and variation across the African continent, specifically with regards to African local di- alects and Arabic dialects that have received little attention.

item.title: Interpretable Machine Learning for Science with PySR and SymbolicRegression.jl
item.description: PySR was developed to democratize and popularize symbolic regression for the sciences, and is built on a high-performance distributed back-end, a flexible search algorithm, and interfaces with several deep learning packages.

item.title: Finding Neurons in a Haystack: Case Studies with Sparse Probing
item.description: Despite rapid adoption and deployment of large language models (LLMs), the internal computations of these models remain opaque and poorly understood.

item.title: Faster OreFSDet : A Lightweight and Effective Few-shot Object Detector for Ore Images
item.description: For the ore particle size detection, obtaining a sizable amount of high-quality ore labeled data is time-consuming and expensive.

item.title: Geometric Latent Diffusion Models for 3D Molecule Generation
item.description: Generative models, especially diffusion models (DMs), have achieved promising results for generating feature-rich geometries and advancing foundational science problems such as molecule design.

item.title: Generalizing Dataset Distillation via Deep Generative Prior
item.description: Dataset Distillation aims to distill an entire dataset's knowledge into a few synthetic images.

item.title: How to Unleash the Power of Large Language Models for Few-shot Relation Extraction?
item.description: Scaling language models have revolutionized widespread NLP tasks, yet little comprehensively explored few-shot relation extraction with large language models.

item.title: Understanding the Generalization Ability of Deep Learning Algorithms: A Kernelized Renyi's Entropy Perspective
item.description: However, the current generalization error bounds within this framework are still far from optimal, while substantial improvements on these bounds are quite challenging due to the intractability of high-dimensional information quantities.

item.title: SLTUNET: A Simple Unified Model for Sign Language Translation
item.description: We propose SLTUNET, a simple unified neural model designed to support multiple SLTrelated tasks jointly, such as sign-to-gloss, gloss-to-text and sign-to-text translation.

item.title: Multimodal Procedural Planning via Dual Text-Image Prompting
item.description: The key challenges of MPP are to ensure the informativeness, temporal coherence, and accuracy of plans across modalities.

item.title: Stratified Adversarial Robustness with Rejection
item.description: We theoretically analyze the stratified rejection setting and propose a novel defense method -- Adversarial Training with Consistent Prediction-based Rejection (CPR) -- for building a robust selective classifier.

item.title: PGrad: Learning Principal Gradients For Domain Generalization
item.description: In this work, we develop a novel DG training strategy, we call PGrad, to learn a robust gradient direction, improving models' generalization ability on unseen domains.

item.title: Memory of recurrent networks: Do we compute it right?
item.description: Numerical evaluations of the memory capacity (MC) of recurrent neural networks reported in the literature often contradict well-established theoretical bounds.

item.title: Leveraging Factored Action Spaces for Efficient Offline Reinforcement Learning in Healthcare
item.description: We study the theoretical properties of our approach, identifying scenarios where it is guaranteed to lead to zero bias when used to approximate the Q-function.

item.title: Data valuation: The partial ordinal Shapley value for machine learning
item.description: Data valuation using Shapley value has emerged as a prevalent research domain in machine learning applications.

item.title: Expressive Mortality Models through Gaussian Process Kernels
item.description: We develop a flexible Gaussian Process (GP) framework for learning the covariance structure of Age- and Year-specific mortality surfaces.

item.title: Towards Summarizing Multiple Documents with Hierarchical Relationships
item.description: Most existing multi-document summarization (MDS) datasets lack human-generated and genuine (i. e., not synthetic) summaries or source documents with explicit inter-document relationships that a summary must capture.

item.title: Prompt as Triggers for Backdoor Attack: Examining the Vulnerability in Language Models
item.description: Our method does not require external triggers and ensures correct labeling of poisoned samples, improving the stealthy nature of the backdoor attack.

item.title: Don't Stop Pretraining? Make Prompt-based Fine-tuning Powerful Learner
item.description: Language models (LMs) trained on vast quantities of unlabelled data have greatly advanced the field of natural language processing (NLP).

item.title: Oil Spill Segmentation using Deep Encoder-Decoder models
item.description: Even though oil spills are in and themselves difficult to clean up, the first and foremost challenge is to detect spills.

item.title: Pick-a-Pic: An Open Dataset of User Preferences for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Using this web app we build Pick-a-Pic, a large, open dataset of text-to-image prompts and real users' preferences over generated images.

item.title: Scalable Mask Annotation for Video Text Spotting
item.description: Video text spotting refers to localizing, recognizing, and tracking textual elements such as captions, logos, license plates, signs, and other forms of text within consecutive video frames.

item.title: MultiLegalSBD: A Multilingual Legal Sentence Boundary Detection Dataset
item.description: Sentence Boundary Detection (SBD) is one of the foundational building blocks of Natural Language Processing (NLP), with incorrectly split sentences heavily influencing the output quality of downstream tasks.

item.title: PU-EdgeFormer: Edge Transformer for Dense Prediction in Point Cloud Upsampling
item.description: We employ graph convolution using EdgeConv, which learns the local geometry and global structure of point cloud better than existing point-to-feature method.

item.title: Sample Efficient Model-free Reinforcement Learning from LTL Specifications with Optimality Guarantees
item.description: Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) is widely used to specify high-level objectives for system policies, and it is highly desirable for autonomous systems to learn the optimal policy with respect to such specifications.

item.title: Long-Tailed Recognition by Mutual Information Maximization between Latent Features and Ground-Truth Labels
item.description: Although contrastive learning methods have shown prevailing performance on a variety of representation learning tasks, they encounter difficulty when the training dataset is long-tailed.

item.title: Unlimiformer: Long-Range Transformers with Unlimited Length Input
item.description: This way, we can index extremely long input sequences, while every attention head in every decoder layer retrieves its top-$k$ keys, instead of attending to every key.

item.title: Optimizing Guided Traversal for Fast Learned Sparse Retrieval
item.description: Recent studies show that BM25-driven dynamic index skipping can greatly accelerate MaxScore-based document retrieval based on the learned sparse representation derived by DeepImpact.
